entry.title: pardnchiu/QuickUI: QuickUI is a lightweight frontend framework built on vanilla JavaScript and native APIs. Supports data binding, i18n support, event binding, conditional rendering, and loop rendering.
entry.content: QuickUI is a lightweight frontend framework built on vanilla JavaScript and native APIs. Supports data binding, i18n support, event binding, conditional rendering, and loop rendering.

entry.title: JS55CT/GeoWKTer: GeoWKTer is a lightweight JS library for converting Well-Known Text (WKT) to GeoJSON. It handles Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, and GeometryCollection. Ideal for small frontend projects, it efficiently parses and converts spatial data with minimal dependencies.
entry.content: GeoWKTer is a lightweight JS library for converting Well-Known Text (WKT) to GeoJSON. It handles Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, and GeometryCollection. Ideal for small frontend projects, it efficiently parses and converts spatial data with minimal dependencies.

entry.title: trifkee/NavKit: A lightweight and flexible navigation library for handling keyboard and remote-based navigation in web and TV applications. With built-in support for directional movement, focus management, and cyclic navigation, NavKit ensures a seamless user experience across different input devices.
entry.content: A lightweight and flexible navigation library for handling keyboard and remote-based navigation in web and TV applications. With built-in support for directional movement, focus management, and cyclic navigation, NavKit ensures a seamless user experience across different input devices.

entry.title: nigrosimone/turbo-array: Turbo Array is a lightweight, high-performance library that allows you to build lazy evaluation pipelines for arrays. It supports operations like filter, map, reduce, forEach, and join, executing them efficiently. A method build with Turbo Array is 4x faster than vanilla version.
entry.content: Turbo Array is a lightweight, high-performance library that allows you to build lazy evaluation pipelines for arrays. It supports operations like filter, map, reduce, forEach, and join, executing them efficiently. A method build with Turbo Array is 4x faster than vanilla version.

entry.title: surya4824/Stop-Watch: A simple and interactive stopwatch built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It allows users to start, stop, and reset the timer with a smooth and responsive UI. Features : Start, pause, and reset functionality , Precise time tracking in milliseconds ,Responsive and user-friendly design , Lightweight and efficient performance
entry.content: A simple and interactive stopwatch built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It allows users to start, stop, and reset the timer with a smooth and responsive UI. Features : Start, pause, and reset functionality , Precise time tracking in milliseconds ,Responsive and user-friendly design , Lightweight and efficient performance

entry.title: GWMDhananjaya/React-color-picker: A React color picker using React hooks (useState, useRef) that lets users select a color and view its HEX, RGB, HSL, and HSV values. Styled with Tailwind CSS, it is lightweight, efficient, and easy to integrate into any React project.
entry.content: A React color picker using React hooks (useState, useRef) that lets users select a color and view its HEX, RGB, HSL, and HSV values. Styled with Tailwind CSS, it is lightweight, efficient, and easy to integrate into any React project.
